subject: A new open source testing framework - Jetif
msgSnippet: Hi, All I d like to introduce a new testing framework to you. As we know, JUnit is a great regression testing framework, while you have to hard code all test
messageBody:
Hi, All

I'd like to introduce a new testing framework to you.

As we know, JUnit is a great regression testing framework,
while you have to hard code all test data because its
"no-param, no-return" design. You have to recompile your code
when you want to change the test data. And another issue is
there are some features desired by developers while not
included in the framework, you have to use extra extensions
to do something such as logging, result recording...

To solve these problems, I create a new testing framework
which separate test code and data, it's called "Jetif".
The Jetif is designed for the purpose that to provides a
powerful and flexiable testing framework with many of
features which developers desired.

There is a short article to compare Jetif and JUnit+JTestCase:
http://jetif.sourceforge.net/comparison.html

Please visit http://sourceforge.net/projects/jetif/
for more information.

Best Regards
-----------
Vicky Wang
